fix: Simplify message serialization to the iframe.

No longer use `!!!` as the separator between the command and data. Instead, just send a serialized object with the `command` and `data` fields.

Merge pull request #40 from mozilla/issues-38-39-zindex-background-color

feat: Reliers can set the lightbox background and zIndex.

feat: Reliers can set the lightbox background and zIndex.

Example usage:
```js
var relierClient = new FxaRelierClient(<client_id>);
relierClient.auth.signIn({
  state: <state>,
  scope: 'profile',
  redirectUri: <redirect_uri>,
  ui: 'lightbox',
  zIndex: 20000,
  background: '#000'
})
```

Merge pull request #22 from mozilla/issue-16-profile

profile and token namespaces. r=vladikoff

Install the bower deps in `postinstall`.

This is needed so micrajax is available and we don't blow up.
Rename *`UI` to *`Broker` for conceptual parity with the content server.
cleanup, move the `clientSecret` to the `options` block of the TokenAPI.

feat: Add the .token and .profile namespaces.

See https://github.com/mozilla/fxa-oauth-server/blob/master/docs/api.md

* Move the `auth` namespace from FxaRelierClient.js to client/auth/api.js
* The XHR module uses micrajax to do the actual XHR requests. In theory this should also be compatible with node using the xhr2 module. I have not yet tested this.
* Add a responder addon that makes setting up sinon responses super simple.
* Remove the comment about `force_email`

fixes #16

Add a CHANGELOG.md shell, bump the version in bower.json, add a bump.js task which overrides auto-creation of a tag and the push to the remote. The tag is created by buildcontrol.

Merge pull request #21 from mozilla/issue-13-load-oauth-server

fix(client): Redirect to the oauth server instead of the content server.
The lightbox needs to know the content server host to be able to postMessage.

fix(client): Redirect to the oauth server instead of the content server.

The OAuth API contract specifies the user is first redirected to the OAuth server, then to the Content server. Honor this contract.

fixes #13

feat(client): add `auth.forceAuth` to use the /oauth/force_auth endpoint on the content server.

Merge pull request #17 from mozilla/issue-15-no-cached-creds

feat: Reliers can specify an email and disable cached creds.

fixes #15 
r=ckarlof

feat(client): add `auth.forceAuth` to use the /oauth/force_auth endpoint on the content server.

Remove the `force_email` parameter to signIn. This now mirrors how the OAuth and Content servers work.

fixes #18

feat: Reliers can specify an email and disable cached creds.

A relier can specify an `email` parameter used to pre-fill the email field in the content server. Specifying `email=blank` will disable cached credentials.

fixes #15

feat(docs): Add some basic API documents.

`vendor`->`<location_of_relier_library>` for clarity

* `redirected`->`rejected` in API.md when talking about promises and missing parameters.

* Add an installation section to README.md
feat(docs): Add some basic API documents.

Merge pull request #3 from mozilla/initial-version

Initial checkin of the lightbox/redirect APIs.

r=zaach, 6a68
No need for events and function helpers, we only support IE9+ which already do the right thing.

Remove the `lightbox` and `redirect` namespaces.

* The user calls `client.auth.signIn` or `client.auth.signUp` instead, passing in a `ui` field.
Subclasses of AuthenticationAPI only have to worry about overriding `openFxa`
Extract common authentication API functions to a common class, AuthenticationAPI
Add the redirect flow.
Add `force_email` to signin. Add more unit tests to the lightbox API to ensure the lightbox is opened to the correct page and that results/errors are propagated.
Try to add more tests to the FxaRelierClient. Break up the initialization of the lightbox api
call Lightbox.load with the URL to load.
Add YUIDoc docs. Create the FxaRelierClient with a clientId as a required parameter.
Enable all the browsers, but only one Firefox.

Set up for travis tests.

Only enable Firefox 18 for now.
Add more tests around requierd options. Split out some helper functions into their own modules.

Initial checkin of the lightbox API.

* Bring over lots of the grunt infrastructure from fxa-js-client
Initial commit
